content.question: Which of the following best supports a claim that an E. coli strain has a mutation in gene <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext mathvariant="italic">E</mtext></math> that results in the production of a nonfunctional enzyme?

choices.label: Cells of this strain synthesize very little of the repressor protein and produce a large amount of tryptophan.
RNA polymerase does not bind to the promoter of the operon in cells of this strain unless tryptophan is added to the nutrient medium.
The operator sequence of the operon always has repressor proteins bound to it, independent of the amount of tryptophan in the nutrient medium.
mRNA is continuously transcribed from the operon, but the amount of tryptophan produced from the cells of this strain remains low.

content.answer: mRNA is continuously transcribed from the operon, but the amount of tryptophan produced from the cells of this strain remains low.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
